title: Sampler, 1812
medium:
Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered on plain weave foundation
inscribed:
Sally Leonard's sampler  worked in Hardwick 1812 in the 12th year of my age
Born in Taunton September 16 1800
provenance:
By 1900, Mrs. Janet L. Barney
1900, Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration
creditline: Gift of Mrs. Janet L. Barney
description:
A deeply pointed border at the top with flowers, followed by several bands of alphabets and numerals separated by narrow geometric borders, an inscription and verse:
Pinks will fade and tulips wither but a virtuous mind will bloom forever

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, 1812.
1812. Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered on plain weave foundation. Gift of Mrs. Janet L. Barney. 1900-2-1.
